name: Clin T Thyroid
title: Clinical T
notes:
**Note 1:** Assign 88 for in situ cases (behavior code /2). TNM does not include an in situ category for thyroid tumors.

**Note 2:**  TNM considers all anaplastic carcinomas to be T4.

**Note 3:** Tumor size must be known to assign a value of T1, T2 or T3 or their (sub)categories. You may use a physicianâs statement of the T category if this is the only information in the medical record. If the tumor appears to be in the T1, T2 or T3 (sub)categories, but no size or category is specified, assign TX.

**Note 4:** For the following descriptions, assign the appropriate T category based on the tumor size.

    Single invasive tumor confined to thyroid
    Extension into thyroid capsule, but not beyond
    Multiple foci confined to thyroid

    Confined to thyroid, NOS   
    Localized, NOS

**Note 5:** Multifocal tumors of all histological types should be designated (m) (the largest determines the classification), e.g, T2. Record the information regarding solitary vs. multifocal tumors in Site-Specific Factor 1.
footnotes: \* T4 is not defined by UICC in the 7th edition. Approval has been provided by UICC to use "Tumor invades bone, nerve or extrinsic deep muscles" as T4.
